explanations.machine learning: The paper discusses the use of machine learning techniques, specifically symbolic regression and genetic programming, to develop a credit scoring model.
explanations.supervised learning: The study involves supervised learning as it uses labeled data to train models for predicting credit risk.
explanations.regression: The paper focuses on regression techniques, including symbolic regression, to approximate credit risk metrics.
explanations.support vector machine: The paper compares the performance of Gaussian Support Vector Machines (GSVMs) with other regression models.
explanations.SVM: SVM is mentioned as one of the benchmark methodologies used in the study.
explanations.decision tree: Regression Trees, a type of decision tree, are mentioned as one of the benchmark models.
explanations.neural network: Multilayer Perceptrons (MLPs), a type of neural network, are mentioned as one of the benchmark models.
